I don’t know your favorite crypto yet.

## TL;DR
You haven’t told me. If you share it, I’ll remember it for future chats. Given your repo work with monerod/p2pool/xmrig, is it Monero (XMR)?

## Quick picker
- Monero (XMR)
- Bitcoin (BTC)
- Ethereum (ETH)
- Solana (SOL)
- Other — tell me which one

Reply with your pick and whether you want me to save it.
What is my third favorite crypto?

I don’t know your third favorite crypto yet.

## TL;DR
You haven’t told me your rankings. If you share your top 3 in order, I’ll remember them for future chats.

## Quick set
Reply with your ranked list like this:
1) First favorite: …
2) Second favorite: …
3) Third favorite: …

## Hint based on your work
Given your repo includes monerod/p2pool/xmrig, Monero (XMR) might be in your top 3—want to confirm the exact order?
What are the top level directories in Coin?

Assuming you mean the Coin3D core library repo (coin3d/coin), the top-level directories are: .github, cmake, doc, include, src, tests, and examples [2, 3].

## TL;DR
- Top-level dirs: .github, cmake, doc, include, src, tests, examples [2, 3].

## Directory overview
- .github — CI workflows and issue templates [2].
- cmake — CMake modules and build helpers [2].
- doc — Documentation assets [2, 3].
- include — Public headers (e.g., Inventor/…) [2, 3].
- src — Library source code [2, 3].
- tests — Unit/regression tests [2].
- examples — Sample programs (if present on the branch) [2].

## Notes
- Structure can vary slightly by branch/release; refer to the repo root and README for the current layout [2, 3].  
- For background and build notes, the project wiki is also helpful [1].

webResultsPreview.title: Home · coin3d/coin Wiki · GitHub
webResultsPreview.snippet: Coin3D is a high-level, retained-mode toolkit for effective 3D graphics development. It is API compatible with Open Inventor 2.1. Coin3D is Free Software, published under the BSD 3-clause license .

webResultsPreview.title: GitHub - coin3d/coin: Coin3D core library
webResultsPreview.snippet: Coin3D core library. Contribute to coin3d/coin development by creating an account on GitHub.
